abstract: Financial experts and Western banks are focusing on countries like Bulgaria, where Greek-owned banks hold around 20 percent of deposits, as they try to assess ripple effects of Greek default; of particular concern is that no one knows what irrational and destructive forces will be unleashed by Greek default, as banks in Bulgaria are widely regarded to be financially sound.
lead_paragraph: Nobody knows what destructive forces could be unleashed if Greece fails to resolve its crisis, and Bulgaria — home to several Greek-owned banks — has much to lose.

headline.main: Despite Assurances, Bulgaria Fears a Spillover of Troubles From Greece
headline.print_headline: Despite Assurances, Bulgaria Fears a Spillover of Troubles From Greece

snippet: Nobody knows what destructive forces could be unleashed if Greece fails to resolve its crisis, and Bulgaria — home to several Greek-owned banks — has much to lose.
